TITLE: Bill Gates has 'never been a big New Year’s resolution person’ — why that's smart, according to a clinical psychologist
SUMMARY: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates is opting out of setting a New Year's resolution for 2022. Here's why one clinical psychology expert says that's a smart move.

TITLE: 5 ways to reset your retirement savings and save more in 2022
SUMMARY: The new year brings opportunities for many Americans in their careers and financial lives.

TITLE: One country is home to half of the 10 most expensive Michelin-starred restaurants in the world
SUMMARY: To find the most expensive Michelin-starred restaurants, the cooking website Chef's Pencil researched dinner tasting menus in more than 450 restaurants.

TITLE: Watch a young Bill Gates discuss Microsoft and Apple's rises in a 1994 employee orientation video
SUMMARY: A 15-minute video, restored and posted online, features a 39-year-old Bill Gates discussing the founding of Microsoft and collaborations with future rival Apple.

TITLE: Mark Cuban has lived by this ‘best’ advice from his dad
SUMMARY: The Dallas Mavericks owner called his father the most impressive person he ever met, and singled out a line from his dad that has always stuck with him.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot surges to $540 million — yet doesn't even crack the list of 10 largest lottery wins
SUMMARY: Between Powerball and Mega Millions, the top 10 largest jackpots ever won range from $648 million to nearly $1.6 billion.

TITLE: Ex-NBA superstar Dwyane Wade says questioning everything is the best way to learn a new skill — here’s why
SUMMARY: Three-time NBA champion Dwyane Wade says his post-NBA business career comes from his willingness to ask questions about topics he doesn't know. Here's why.

TITLE: Manhattan real estate breaks record in 2021, reaching $30 billion in sales
SUMMARY: "Clearly, the pace of the recovery in 2021 was faster than I think most people anticipated," said Jonathan Miller, CEO of Miller Samuel. "It's been startling."

TITLE: Don’t make these 6 money mistakes in your 30s, says former JPMorgan retirement expert
SUMMARY: Anne Lester, former portfolio manager and Head of Retirement Solutions for JPMorgan, shares the mistakes people in their 30s should avoid to retire early.
